actor_awards.notes: Best known for his leading roles in two long-running television series: as Jim Anderson in 'Father Knows Best' and as the title character in 'Marcus Welby, M.D.', for which he won Emmy Awards. He had a prolific film career at MGM prior to his TV success.

filmography.title: Crossfire
filmography.role_description: A calm, pipe-smoking police detective investigating a hate crime murder.
filmography.plot: A man is murdered, apparently by one of a group of soldiers who had just been released from the army.

filmography.title: The Enchanted Cottage
filmography.role_description: A disfigured war veteran who finds love and beauty with a homely maid in a magical cottage.
filmography.plot: A homing maid and a scarred veteran fall in love and are transformed by the magic of their cottage, appearing beautiful to one another.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Original Music Score (Film)

filmography.title: Sitting Pretty
filmography.role_description: A suburban father who reluctantly hires the eccentric genius Lynn Belvedere as a nanny.
filmography.plot: A family hires a man as a babysitter, only to find that he is a genius who proceeds to take over the household and write a tell-all book.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild Award: Win – Best Written American Comedy (Film)

filmography.title: Secret Agent
filmography.role_description: An American on a secret mission in Switzerland who becomes entangled with British spies.
filmography.plot: British agents are sent to Switzerland to assassinate a German spy, but they are unsure of his identity.

filmography.title: Northwest Passage
filmography.role_description: A mapmaker and artist who joins Rogers' Rangers on a dangerous expedition.
filmography.plot: Rogers' Rangers fight the French and Indians during the French and Indian War.

filmography.title: They Won't Believe Me
filmography.role_description: A philandering stockbroker on trial for murder who recounts the events leading to his downfall.
filmography.plot: A man on trial for murder tells his story of infidelity and bad choices, claiming he is innocent of the crime.

filmography.title: H.M. Pulham, Esq.
filmography.role_description: A conservative Boston businessman who reflects on his life and a past romance when writing a biography for a class reunion.
filmography.plot: A stuffy Bostonian looks back on his life and wonders if he made the right choice in giving up a spirited girl for a conventional marriage.

filmography.title: The Mortal Storm
filmography.role_description: A young German whose embrace of Nazi ideology tears his family and friendships apart.
filmography.plot: A family in 1933 Germany is torn apart when the father, a Jewish science professor, refuses to bow to the new Nazi regime.

filmography.title: Western Union
filmography.role_description: An Eastern engineer surveying the telegraph line across the West.
filmography.plot: A reformed outlaw saves the Western Union wire from Confederate guerrillas and Indians.

filmography.title: Three Comrades
filmography.role_description: One of three disillusioned WWI veterans trying to survive in post-war Germany.
filmography.plot: Three German friends in the post-WWI era fall in love with a dying woman.

filmography.title: Journey for Margaret
filmography.role_description: An American reporter in London who helps war orphans during the Blitz.
filmography.plot: An American couple in London during the Blitz try to adopt two war orphans.

filmography.title: A Yank at Oxford
filmography.role_description: An Oxford student and rival to the cocky American protagonist played by Robert Taylor.
filmography.plot: A cocky American track athlete gets a scholarship to Oxford University, where he clashes with British customs and students.

filmography.title: Claudia
filmography.role_description: The patient husband of a naive young wife who is struggling to grow up.
filmography.plot: A child-bride struggles to mature and deal with her mother's illness and her own pregnancy.

filmography.title: The Canterville Ghost
filmography.role_description: An American soldier and descendant of a cowardly ghost who must perform a brave deed to free his ancestor.
filmography.plot: A cowardly ghost is doomed to haunt his castle until a descendant performs a brave deed.

filmography.title: Navy Blue and Gold
filmography.role_description: A cynical cadet at the Naval Academy who clashes with his peers.
filmography.plot: Three young men from different backgrounds room together at the Naval Academy and play football.

filmography.title: The Bride Wore Red
filmography.role_description: A bohemian postal clerk who loves the protagonist, despite her pursuit of a wealthy aristocrat.
filmography.plot: A cabaret singer poses as an aristocrat at a mountain resort to snag a wealthy husband.

filmography.title: Lady Be Good
filmography.role_description: A songwriter who struggles to balance his career and marriage to his lyricist partner.
filmography.plot: A composer and lyricist couple divorce but continue to work together, realizing they are still in love.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('The Last Time I Saw Paris')

filmography.title: Joe Smith, American
filmography.role_description: A factory worker who is kidnapped by enemy agents seeking military secrets.
filmography.plot: A factory worker with knowledge of a secret bombsight is kidnapped and tortured by Nazi spies.

filmography.title: Relentless
filmography.role_description: A cowboy wrongly accused of murder who must find the real killer to clear his name.
filmography.plot: A cowboy is framed for murder and pursues the real killer while being chased by the law.

filmography.title: The Shining Hour
filmography.role_description: A member of a wealthy family whose brother marries a nightclub dancer.
filmography.plot: A nightclub dancer marries into a wealthy farming family, causing tension and romantic complications.

filmography.title: That Forsyte Woman
filmography.role_description: An architect who falls in love with the wife of his fiancée's uncle.
filmography.plot: In Victorian London, a woman marries into a wealthy, stuffy family but falls in love with her niece's fiancé.

filmography.title: Stowaway
filmography.role_description: A playboy traveling by ship who becomes the guardian of an orphaned girl (Shirley Temple).
filmography.plot: An orphan stranded in Shanghai hides in the car of a playboy, who inadvertently takes her aboard a cruise ship.

filmography.title: Goodbye, My Fancy
filmography.role_description: A college president who reconnects with a former flame, now a congresswoman.
filmography.plot: A congresswoman returns to her old college to receive an honorary degree and rekindles a romance with the college president.

filmography.title: Marcus Welby, M.D.
filmography.role_description: The pilot movie that launched the series about a kindhearted general practitioner.
filmography.plot: An aging doctor suffers a heart attack and hires a young motorcycle-riding doctor to help with his practice.
filmography.awards: Emmy: Win – Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series (Series)

filmography.title: The Second Woman
filmography.role_description: A brooding architect tormented by the mysterious death of his fiancée.
filmography.plot: An architect is plagued by a series of accidents and the suspicion that he killed his fiancée, until a new love investigates.

filmography.title: Spitfire
filmography.role_description: An engineer who falls for a mountain girl played by Katharine Hepburn.
filmography.plot: A mountain girl who believes she has healing powers is driven from her home by superstitious neighbors.
